result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Fenton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Must follow all rules of Probation.
Concurrent with: 14CF224/16CF14

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. If not paid by the end of Probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment as long as good faith effort has been made.

$58.68 restitution to be paid to Probation while on Probation for Wal-Mart. If not paid by end of Probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment as long as good effort has been made. Bond to applied to restitution.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation. If not paid by end of Probation, may be reduced to civil judgment as long as good effort has been made.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No contact with David Madison unless permission by Probation. No illegal substances. No elective office. No voting until civil rights are restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights until restored.
Must complete an AODA assessment and compliance.

timeConds.notes:
Subject to work release. NOT subject to good time. 176 days credit if revoked for files (14CF224/15CF472/16CF14).
Concurrent with: 14CF224/16CF14

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time & Work Release.
Concurrent with: 14CF224 - Count 1

Any outstanding financial obligations will be reduced to a civil judgment, made payable to the Clerk of Court's Office and subject to tax intercept and/or other collection efforts.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  

16CF14-Poss meth-3 yrs WSP, 18 mo IC & 18 mo ES, concurrent with count 1 in 15CF472 & 14CF224.  Follow thru with AODA & compliance.  AS, no illgal drugs. $ still owing, see revocation order & warrant. All payable during supervision, $50/mo if employed once released.  FTP-judgment.  520 days credit.  Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  Qualifies for SA pgm & CIP.
